IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik, preteklik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
To put something in a particular place or position
pomeni nekaj premakniti na določeno mesto ali v določen položaj.

seg.quote: She put her hand on his arm.
I put her suitcase on the table.
Marsha put her cup down.
The women put a garland round her neck.

sense.def:
To put someone somewhere
pomeni poskrbeti, da nekdo nekam gre in tam ostane.

seg.quote: They had to put him into an asylum.
I have to put the kids to bed.

sense.def:
To put an idea or remark in a particular way
pomeni zamisel ali pripombo izraziti na določen način.

seg.quote: They cannot put their feelings into words.
To put it briefly, the man is mad and may become dangerous.

sense.def:
To put a question or suggestion to someone
pomeni nekoga nekaj vprašati ali mu predlagati.

seg.quote: I put this question to Dr Leslie Cook.
I put it to him that, in fact, he was losing a good worker.

sense.def:
To put a person or thing in a particular state or situation
pomeni povzročiti, da je oseba ali stvar v določenem stanju ali položaju.

seg.quote: It puts me in a rather difficult position.
The company closed several months ago, putting 120 people out of a job.
This would put the party into power.

sense.def:
To put something on people or things
pomeni povzročiti, da osebe ali stvari nekaj imajo ali da nekaj vpliva nanje.

seg.quote: It puts a tremendous responsibility on us.
We put pressure on our children to learn to read.
...a plan to put a tax on children's clothes.

sense.def:
To put written information somewhere
pomeni na roko ali računalnik napisati podatke nekam.

seg.quote: Put all the details on the card.
For ‘profession’ he put down simply ‘business man’.

sense.def:
To put something across
ali
to put something over
pomeni nekaj uspešno opisati ali razložiti nekomu.

seg.quote: You need the skill to put your ideas across.
It is difficult for her to put over her own thoughts.

sense.def:
To put something aside
pomeni pustiti nekaj ob strani, da bi tisto lahko reševali ali uporabiti pozneje.

seg.quote: Your best plan is to put aside funds to cover these bills.

sense.def:
To put the cost, age, or value of something at a particular amount
pomeni presoditi, kolikšna je cena, starost ali vrednost nečesa.

seg.quote: The pipeline's cost is now put at 2.7 billion pounds.

sense.def:
To put something away
pomeni dati nekaj tja, kjer je ponavadi spravljeno.

seg.quote: Right—put your books away.

sense.def:
To be put away
pomeni, da nekoga pošljejo v zapor ali napotijo v bolnišnico za duševne bolezni;

seg.quote: The doctor wanted to have him put away.

sense.def:
To put something back
pomeni nekaj preložiti na poznejši čas.

seg.quote: The meeting's been put back till Monday.
This will put production back at least a month.

sense.def:
To put money by
pomeni varčevati, da bomo denar lahko porabili pozneje.

seg.quote: I've got a bit put by.

sense.def:
Kadar vojska, policija ali vlada
puts down a riot or rebellion
, s silo naredi konec nemirom ali uporu.

seg.quote: These riots were put down by the local police.

sense.def:
To put someone down
pomeni kritizirati ali osmešiti nekoga;

seg.quote: ...her infuriating habit of putting people down in small ways.

sense.def:
Kadar žival
is put down
, jo ubijejo, ker je nevarna ali zelo bolna.

seg.quote: We had to have the cat put down.

sense.def:
To put something down to a particular thing
pomeni verjeti, da se je nekaj zgodilo zaradi nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: I put it down to arthritis.

sense.def:
To put forward something or someone
pomeni reči, da bi bila neka stvar ali oseba primerna za določen namen ali delo.

seg.quote: They rejected every proposal put forward.

sense.def:
To put in an amount of time or effort doing something
pomeni porabiti kar nekaj časa ali napora za neko opravilo.

seg.quote: I put in fifteen hours of work daily.
You've put in a lot of work.

sense.def:
To put in a request
ali
to put in for something
pomeni uradno zaprositi ali se prijaviti za kaj.

seg.quote: I put in a request for an interview.
After the gamekeeper died, Father put in for his job.

sense.def:
To put time, strength, or energy into an activity
pomeni porabiti določen čas, moč ali energijo za neko dejavnost.

seg.quote: She put all her energy into tidying the place up.

sense.def:
To put money into a business or project
pomeni porabiti denar za neki posel ali projekt v pričakovanju, da nam bo prinesel dobiček.

seg.quote: Capitalists are encouraged to put their wealth into productive enterprises.

sense.def:
To put something off
pomeni podaljšati čas do trenutka, ko bo nekaj izvedeno.

seg.quote: Don't put it off till tomorrow.

sense.def:
To put someone off
pomeni povzročiti, da si nekdo ne prizadeva več dobiti ali narediti nečesa, kar je imel v načrtu.

seg.quote: Nothing would put her off once she had made up her mind.

sense.def:
To put someone off something
pomeni povzročiti, da nekomu nekaj ni všeč.

seg.quote: I had seen enough to put me off farm work.

sense.def:
To put on a piece of clothing
pomeni nadeti si oblačilo.

seg.quote: I put on my jacket.

sense.def:
To put on a show, exhibition, or service
pomeni izvesti, pripraviti ali organizirati predstavo, razstavo ali dejavnost.

seg.quote: A French company has put on ‘Peter Grimes’.
They're putting on a special train service.

sense.def:
To put on weight
pomeni postati težji.

seg.quote: She had put on over a stone since I last saw her.

sense.def:
To put on a piece of equipment or a device
pomeni sprožiti delovanje nekega pripomočka ali naprave.

seg.quote: He put on the light.
She put the radio on.

sense.def:
To put on a record, tape, or video
pomeni položiti ploščo, kaseto ali videokaseto v ustrezno napravo in poslušati ali gledati, kar je na njej posneto.

To put food on
pomeni začeti kuhati.

seg.quote: She often forgets to put the dinner on before she goes to collect the children.

sense.def:
To put on a way of behaving
pomeni vesti se tako, kot ni naravno za nas, ali tako, da ne pokažemo pravih čustev.

cit.quote: prisiljeno se vesti, narediti se, prenarejati se

seg.quote: She put on that look of not caring.
I don't see why you have to put on a phoney English accent.

sense.def:
To put out an announcement or story
pomeni poskrbeti, da bo za neko sporočilo ali zgodbo vedelo veliko ljudi.

seg.quote: He put out a statement denouncing the commission's conclusions.

sense.def:
To put out something
pomeni ustaviti gorenje nečesa.

seg.quote: He helped to put the fire out.

sense.def:
To put out an electric light
pomeni pritisniti na stikalo, da svetilka neha svetiti.

seg.quote: She put out the light.

sense.def:
To put out something
pomeni dati nekaj, kar bomo potrebovali, na tako mesto, da nam bo pri roki.

seg.quote: I put clean clothes out for you on the bed.

sense.def:
To put out one's hand
pomeni premakniti roko naprej in stran od telesa, pogosto zato, da bi nekoga pozdravili.

seg.quote: I walked over to one young woman and put out my hand.

sense.def:
To be put out by something
pomeni biti jezen ali razburjen zaradi tiste stvari.

seg.quote: I was somewhat put out when the audience laughed loudly.

sense.def:
To put oneself out for someone
pomeni narediti nekaj za nekoga, čeprav je to za nas zelo naporno ali nam povzroča težave.

seg.quote: He was putting himself out to please her.

sense.def:
To put through a telephone call or a caller
pomeni vzpostaviti telefonsko zvezo, ki klicočemu omogoča pogovor z osebo, s katero želi govoriti.

seg.quote: ‘Data Room, please.’—‘I'll put you through.’

sense.def:
To put someone through an unpleasant experience
pomeni povzročiti, da nekdo doživi nekaj neprijetnega.

seg.quote: I'm sorry to put you through this again.

sense.def:
To put something together
pomeni sestaviti dele nečesa v celoto, tako da lahko tisto uporabimo.

seg.quote: He started to put his fishing rod together.

sense.def:
To put an event together
pomeni organizirati ali pripraviti neko prireditev ali dogajanje.

seg.quote: The agency has put together the biggest ever campaign for a new car.

sense.def:
Kadar rečemo, da je ena oseba ali stvar boljša ali večja kot skupina drugih oseb ali stvari
put together
, hočemo povedati, da je precej boljša ali večja kot druge.

seg.quote: He is smarter than all your colonels put together.

sense.def:
To put up a wall or a building
pomeni zgraditi zid ali stavbo.

seg.quote: We shall have to put up a fence.

sense.def:
To put up an umbrella or hood
pomeni razpreti nekaj, na primer dežnik ali kapuco, da bi bili zavarovani.

To put up a poster or notice
pomeni pritrditi plakat ali obvestilo na steno ali desko.

To put up resistance to something
pomeni postaviti se v bran ali proti nečemu.

seg.quote: America has put up so much resistance to Concorde.
We had put up a fierce struggle.

sense.def:
To put up the money for something
pomeni dati denar, ki je potreben za nekaj.

seg.quote: The National Council for the Arts put up half the cost.

sense.def:
To put up the price of something
pomeni povzročiti, da se cena nečesa poveča.

seg.quote: This is what happens when they put up prices too far.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
puts someone up
, tista oseba nekaj časa preživi pri njem.

seg.quote: I offered to put him up for the night.

sense.def:
To put someone up to something
pomeni spodbuditi nekoga, da naredi nekaj slabega ali neumnega.

seg.quote: Julie herself had probably put them up to it.

sense.def:
To put up with something
pomeni nekaj sprejemati ali se nečemu ne upirati, čeprav nam ni všeč ali se nam ne zdi dovolj dobro.

seg.quote: The natives have to put up with gaping tourists.
I can't think why I put up with it.
